intro: Astragalus mirabilis subsp. czargicus, commonly known as the Czargi milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the steppes of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are pinnately compound with numerous small leaflets. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
